Node.name: FIBARO FGK10x Door Opening Sensor Puerta Porche

Value.label: Operation Mode
Value.Help: Parameter defines device operation mode.

Item.label: Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor

Value.label: DOOR/WINDOW/ALARM
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: Visual LED indications
Value.Help: This parameter defines events indicated by the visual LED indicator. Disabling events might extend battery life. 0 - no indications 1 - indication of opening/closing status change (input IN) 2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical) 4 - indication of device tampering

Value.label: Range test after double click
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: 2nd association group triggers
Value.Help: Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: Commands sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

Value.label: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Time delay of ON command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which ON command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Time delay of OFF command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which OFF command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Type of sent alarm frames
Value.Help: Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller and 3rd association group Alarm. If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value.

Value.label: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

Value.label: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 5th association group.

Item.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

Value.label: Interval of temperature measurements
Value.Help: This parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. 0 - temperature measurements disabled 5-32400 - time in seconds

Value.label: Temperature reports threshold
Value.Help: This parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller. 0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled 1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30°C, 0.1°C step)

Value.label: Interval of temperature reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. 0 - periodic temperature reports disabled 5-32400 - time in seconds

Value.label: Temperature offset
Value.Help: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). (0,1°C steps)

Value.label: Temperature alarm reports
Value.Help: Temperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller. Thresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56.

Value.label: High temperature alarm threshold
Value.Help: If temperature is higher than set value, overheat notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). 0-1000 (0-100°C, 0.1°C step).

Value.label: Low temperature alarm threshold
Value.Help: If temperature is lower than the set value, underheat notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). 300-700 (-30-70°C, 0.1°C step)

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned to different events. To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. To activate all scenes set the value to 3903. 1 - [ID 10] opening door/window (single click). 2 - [ID 11] closing door/window (single click). 4 - [ID 12] holding. 8 - [ID 13] releasing. 16 - [ID 14] double click. 32 - [ID 15] triple click. 256 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window opened. 512 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window closed. 1024 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window opened. 2048 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window closed.

Value.label: Alarm broadcast
Value.Help: Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. They are not repeated by the mesh network. 0 - broadcasts inactive. 1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active. 2 - sensor alarm broadcast active. 4 - tamper alarm broadcast active.

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group Lifeline 0 - none of the groups sent as secure. 1 - 2nd group ”Control” sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group ”Alarm” sent as secure. 4 - 4th group “Sensor ZW3” sent as secure. 8 - 5th group “Tamper ZW3” sent as secure.

Value.label: Switch All
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF

Value.label: Motion sensor's sensitivity
Value.Help: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. Available settings: 8 - 255 Default setting: 10

Value.label: Motion sensor's blind time (insensitivity)
Value.Help: Period of time through which the PIR sensor is "blind" (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion. The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened. The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6. Available settings: 0 - 15 Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value + 1) Default setting: 15 (8 seconds)

Value.label: PIR sensor's pulse counter
Value.Help: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It's not recommended to modify this parameter settings. Available settings: 0 - 3 Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1) Default setting: 1 (2 pulses)

Value.label: PIR sensor's window time
Value.Help: Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It's not recommended to modify this parameter setting. Available settings: 0 - 3 Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 4 x (value + 1) Default setting: 2 (12 seconds)

Value.label: Motion alarm cancellation delay
Value.Help: Motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor's "Blind Time"). Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 30 (30 seconds)

Value.label: PIR sensor operating mode
Value.Help: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings. Default setting: 0 (always active)

Item.label: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

Value.label: Night / day
Value.Help: The parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 200 (200 lux)

Value.label: Basic command class frames configuration
Value.Help: The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor. Values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters. Default setting: 0 (ON and OFF)

Item.label: BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.
only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.
only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

Value.label: BASIC ON command frame value
Value.Help: The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state. Available settings: 0 - 255 Default setting: 255

Value.label: BASIC OFF command frame value
Value.Help: The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after the cancellation delay time, specified in parameter 6, has passed. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state. Available settings: 0 - 255 Default setting: 0

Value.label: Tamper sensitivity
Value.Help: The parameter determines the changes in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm being reported - g-force acceleration. Available settings: 0 - 122 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive) Default setting: 15 (0.224g)

Value.label: Tamper alarm cancellation delay
Value.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Another tampering detected during the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 30 (seconds)

Value.label: Tamper operating modes
Value.Help: The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports. Tamper: Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class. Cancellation: Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm command class after the time period set in parameter 22 (Tamper Alarm Cancellation Delay). Orientation: Sensor's orientation in space is reported in Fibaro Command Class after the time period set in parameter 22. Vibration: The maximum level of vibrations recorded in the time period set in parameter 22 is reported. Reports stop being sent when the vibrations cease. The reports are sent in Sensor Alarm command class. Value displayed in the "value" field (0 - 100) depends on the vibrations force. Reports to the association groups are sent using Sensor Alarm command class. Default setting: 0 (Tamper)

Value.label: Tamper alarm broadcast mode
Value.Help: The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Illumination report threshold
Value.Help: The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 lux; 0 = reports are not sent) Default setting: 200 (200 lux)

Value.label: Illumination reports interval
Value.Help: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity. Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent) Default setting: 0 (no reports) NOTE Frequent reports will shorten the battery life. Parameter value under 5 may result in blocking the temperature reports.

Value.label: Temperature report threshold
Value.Help: The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5C; 0 = reports are not sent) Default setting: 10 (1C)

Value.label: Interval of temperature measuring
Value.Help: The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = temperature will not be measured) Default setting: 900 (900 seconds) NOTE Frequent reports will shorten the battery life. Parameter value under 5 may result in blocking the illumination reports.

Value.label: Temperature reports interval
Value.Help: The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Temperature offset
Value.Help: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100C) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10C) Default setting: 0

Value.label: LED signaling mode
Value.Help: The parameter determines the way in which LED behaves after motion has been detected. Values 1 and from 3 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled. Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again. Values from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again. Default setting: 10 (flashlight)

Item.label: 1 long blink, LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white for 10 seconds.
Long blink, then short blink, LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white through 10 seconds. Each next detected motion extends the glowing by next 10 seconds.
Long blink, then short blinks White.
Long blink, then short blinks Red.
Long blink, then short blinks Green.
Long blink, then short blinks Blue.
Long blink, then short blinks Yellow.
Long blink, then short blinks Cyan
Long blink, then short blinks Magenta
Long blink, then 2 short blinks, LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Long blink, then 2 short blinks White
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Red
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Green
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Blue
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Yellow
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Cyan
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Magenta

Value.label: LED brightness
Value.Help: The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion. Available settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83) Default setting: 50

Value.label: Ambient illumination level below which LED brightness is set to 1%
Value.Help: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0. Available settings: 0 to parameter 83 value Default setting: 100 (100 lux)

Value.label: Ambient illumination level above which LED brightness is set to 100%
Value.Help: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0. Available settings: parameter 82 value to 65535 Default setting: 1000 (1000 lux) NOTE The value of the parameter 83 must be higher than the value of the parameter 82.

Value.label: Minimum temperature resulting in blue LED illumination
Value.Help: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured. Available settings: 0 to parameter 87 value (degrees Celsius) Default setting: 18 (18C)

Value.label: Maximum temperature resulting in red LED illumination
Value.Help: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured. Available settings: parameter 86 value to 255 (degrees Celsius) Default setting: 28 (28C)

Value.label: LED indicating tamper alarm
Value.Help: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue). Default setting: 1 (on)

Item.label: LED does not indicate tamper alarm.

Node.name: FIBARO FGS223 Double Relay Luz Escalera y Suite

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: First channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

Value.label: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Second channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2st channel controlled by the S2 switch.

Value.label: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Switch type
Value.Help: Inputs type configuration

Item.label: Toggle switch (contact closed - On, contact opened - OFF)
Toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status)

Value.label: Flashing mode report
Value.Help: Enabled / Disabled reports on Flashing mode

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent to specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st lifeline group. 1 - 2nd group sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group sent as secure. 4 - 4th group sent as secure. 8 - 5th group sent as secure. Default setting: 15 (all)

Value.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S1 associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S1 Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Double Click command to de- vices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S2 associations sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S2 Switch ON value sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch OFF value sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch Double Click value sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Double Click command to de- vices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group.

Value.label: Reaction to General Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Flood Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat alarm frame.

Value.label: Flashing alarm duration
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode 1-32000 (0.1-32000s, 1s step) Default: 600 (10min)

Value.label: First channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: First channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: First channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Second Channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: Second channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: Second channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Periodic power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Periodic energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.

Value.label: Profile Buttons 1 & 3
Value.Help: This parameter configures the behavior of the buttons 1 and 3 when the product is in "Gateway Centric Mode"

Value.label: Profile Buttons 2 & 4
Value.Help: This parameter configures the behavior of the buttons 2 and 4 when the product is in "Gateway Centric Mode"

Value.label: Scene Type
Value.Help: This parameter configures the type of command sent when the product is in "Gateway Centric Mode", with buttons profile configuration set in "Scene Behavior".

Value.label: Action Button 1 Mono
Value.Help: When button are set in Mono Button mode they can have 3 different behaviors : 1: They can directly control other nodes with Basic and multi-level command class 2: Send Switch All On command 3: Send Switch All Off command

Value.label: Action Button 2 Mono
Value.Help: When button are set in Mono Button mode they can have 3 different behaviors : 1: They can directly control other nodes with Basic and multi-level command class 2: Send Switch All On command 3: Send Switch All Off command

Value.label: Action Button 3 Mono
Value.Help: When button are set in Mono Button mode they can have 3 different behaviors : 1: They can directly control other nodes with Basic and multi-level command class 2: Send Switch All On command 3: Send Switch All Off command

Value.label: Action Button 4 Mono
Value.Help: When button are set in Mono Button mode they can have 3 different behaviors : 1: They can directly control other nodes with Basic and multi-level command class 2: Send Switch All On command 3: Send Switch All Off command

Item.label: Led Blink on button action and transmission result

Node.name: FIBARO FGK10x Door Opening Sensor Persiana Porche

Value.label: Operation Mode
Value.Help: Parameter defines device operation mode.

Value.label: DOOR/WINDOW/ALARM
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.Help: This parameter defines events indicated by the visual LED indicator. Disabling events might extend battery life. 0 - no indications 1 - indication of opening/closing status change (input IN) 2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical) 4 - indication of device tampering

Value.label: Range test after double click
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: 2nd association group triggers
Value.Help: Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: Commands sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

Value.label: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Time delay of ON command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which ON command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Time delay of OFF command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which OFF command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Type of sent alarm frames
Value.Help: Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller and 3rd association group Alarm. If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value.

Value.label: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

Value.label: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 5th association group.

Item.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

Value.label: Interval of temperature measurements
Value.Help: This parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. 0 - temperature measurements disabled 5-32400 - time in seconds

Value.label: Temperature reports threshold
Value.Help: This parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller. 0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled 1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30C, 0.1C step)

Value.label: Interval of temperature reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. 0 - periodic temperature reports disabled 5-32400 - time in seconds

Value.label: Temperature offset
Value.Help: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). (0,1C steps)

Value.label: Temperature alarm reports
Value.Help: Temperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller. Thresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56.

Value.label: High temperature alarm threshold
Value.Help: If temperature is higher than set value, overheat notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). 0-1000 (0-100C, 0.1C step).

Value.label: Low temperature alarm threshold
Value.Help: If temperature is lower than the set value, underheat notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). 300-700 (-30-70C, 0.1C step)

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned to different events. To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. To activate all scenes set the value to 3903. 1 - [ID 10] opening door/window (single click). 2 - [ID 11] closing door/window (single click). 4 - [ID 12] holding. 8 - [ID 13] releasing. 16 - [ID 14] double click. 32 - [ID 15] triple click. 256 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window opened. 512 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window closed. 1024 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window opened. 2048 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window closed.

Value.label: Alarm broadcast
Value.Help: Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. They are not repeated by the mesh network. 0 - broadcasts inactive. 1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active. 2 - sensor alarm broadcast active. 4 - tamper alarm broadcast active.

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group Lifeline 0 - none of the groups sent as secure. 1 - 2nd group Control sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group Alarm sent as secure. 4 - 4th group Sensor ZW3 sent as secure. 8 - 5th group Tamper ZW3 sent as secure.
